data.content:
verb
-cuses; -cused; -cusing
to focus again: such as
to adjust (something, such as a camera or a lens) again to make an image clear [+ obj]
She refocused the camera. [no obj]
The camera refocuses automatically.
to cause (something, such as attention) to be directed at something different [+ obj]
She refocused her energies toward a career in music.
He needs to refocus his attention on his schoolwork. [no obj]
Sports are not a priority now. You need to refocus and improve your grades.
